title.rendered: Water Treatment Chemical Industry Set to Reach US$ 58 billion by 2034, Providing Clean and Safe Water Solutions Across Municipal, Industrial, and Commercial Sectors

content.rendered:
The market for chemicals used in water treatment is experiencing continuous growth, fueled by increasing demand for clean water and growing awareness of water pollution issues. As concerns over water quality intensify, industries and municipalities are investing in advanced treatment solutions, creating opportunities for companies in the chemical sector

NEWARK, Del, Feb. 16, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — According to Future Market Insights, the water treatment chemical market is expected to reach a valuation of US$ 38.6 billion in 2024. The market is projected to reach US$ 58 billion by 2034, registering a CAGR of 4.2%. This represents a significant growth opportunity for the industry, which plays a crucial role in treating and purifying water for industrial and domestic applications.

The demand for clean water and increasing awareness of water pollution drive market growth. Industrialization, technological advancements, and strict environmental laws in emerging nations also drive the development of the water treatment chemical market.

Population growth and industrial water demand drive the global market for water treatment chemicals. As water reuse and recycling become more important, industries recognize the importance of water. The rise in awareness of the negative effects of water pollution has increased the demand for water treatment chemicals. This demand for innovative solutions to protect water purity and ecosystems drives significant global market growth.

Request Your Sample Report Now! https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/reports/sample/rep-gb-19001

Advancements in water treatment techniques are driving the global expansion of the water treatment chemicals market, addressing pollution and water scarcity concerns. Industrialization also contributes to the demand for efficient water purification and treatment solutions, as water is crucial for various industrial processes. The need for effective solutions further underscores the importance of the industry.

The water treatment chemical industry is experiencing a surge in demand, especially in emerging economies, due to increasing awareness of waterborne diseases and the need for improved water quality. The industry has evolved to meet these demands, driven by population growth, industrialization, pollution awareness, and technological progress, shaping the future trajectory of the water treatment chemical market.

“The water treatment chemical industry is anticipated to undergo changes in the forthcoming decade to fulfill the growing global need for safe and clean water. Innovation in water treatment techniques is likely to be fueled by technological breakthroughs, creating more effective and long-lasting solutions. Furthermore, industry participants are expected to be compelled to embrace greener practices due to regulatory pressures and rising environmental concerns, encouraging a shift towards eco-friendly water treatment chemicals and procedures.” says Nikhil Kaitwade, Associate Vice President at Future Market Insights (FMI).

Key Takeaways from the Water Treatment Chemical Market

  • The United States water treatment chemical industry is projected to experience a CAGR of 4.5% through 2034.
  • Japan’s water treatment chemical industry is expected to demonstrate a moderate CAGR of 5.6% through 2034.
  • The United Kingdom’s water treatment chemical market is anticipated to see a CAGR of 5.2% through 2034.
  • The South Korea water treatment chemical industry showcases a significant CAGR of 6.1% through 2034.
  • The China water treatment chemical industry is expected to display a favorable CAGR of 4.9% through 2034.

Drive Your Business Growth Strategy: Purchase the Report for Key Insights! https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/checkout/19001

Competitive Landscape of the Water Treatment Chemical Market

Innovations and strategic initiatives are transforming the global water treatment chemical sector. Innovations in materials, manufacturing techniques, and water treatment chemistry are pioneered by research and development centers inside water cleansing corporations.

Technological advancements are accelerated by cooperative relationships between government agencies, academic institutions, and industry participants. With their knowledge of large-scale hydro disinfection projects, pH adjusters and stabilizer technology, and water purification technologies, BASF SE, Ecolab Inc., and Solenis LLC are leading the industry. Their combined influence propels water treatment chemical solutions’ innovation, efficiency, and scalability. These qualities are all essential for the sector’s advancement toward broad acceptance and the switch to green hydropower generation.

The demand for water treatment chemicals is increased globally by these producers, promoting innovation, market expansion, and technical developments in the coming decade.

Recent Developments in the Water Treatment Chemical Market

  • LG Chem Ltd. intends to invest US$ 94.5 million in August 2023 to quadruple its South Korean output capacity for water treatment materials. The company plans to build a desalination plant that processes 1.6 billion tons of water annually.
  • Siemens Energy acquired water and wastewater treatment technologies, intellectual property, copyrights, trade secrets, and research and development properties from Lummus Technologies in May 2023.

Key Companies in the Water Treatment Chemical Market

  • BASF SE
  • Ecolab Inc.
  • Solenis LLC
  • Akzo Nobel N.V.
  • Kemira OYJ
  • Suez SA
  • Dow Inc.
  • Lonza Group AG
  • Snf Floerger Group
  • Kurita Water Industries Ltd.
  • LG Chem Ltd.

Explore Extensive Insights through Complete Report Methodology – Request Your Copy! https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/request-report-methodology/rep-gb-19001

Key Segmentation of the Water Treatment Chemical Market

By Type:

  • Corrosion inhibitors
  • Scale inhibitors
  • Biocides & disinfectants
  • Coagulants & flocculants
  • Chelating agents
  • Anti-foaming agents
  • pH adjusters and stabilizers
  • Others

By End-Use Industry:

  • Residential
  • Commercial
  • Industrial

By Region:

  • North America
  • Latin America
  • Europe
  • East Asia
  • South Asia
  • Oceania
  • Middle East and Africa

Author

Nikhil Kaitwade (Associate Vice President at Future Market Insights, Inc.) has over a decade of experience in market research and business consulting. He has successfully delivered 1500+ client assignments, predominantly in Automotive, Chemicals, Industrial Equipment, Oil & Gas, and Service industries.

His core competency circles around developing research methodology, creating a unique analysis framework, statistical data models for pricing analysis, competition mapping, and market feasibility analysis. His expertise also extends wide and beyond analysis, advising clients on identifying growth potential in established and niche market segments, investment/divestment decisions, and market entry decision-making.

Nikhil holds an MBA degree in Marketing and IT and a Graduate in Mechanical Engineering. Nikhil has authored several publications and quoted in journals like EMS Now, EPR Magazine, and EE Times.

Have a Look at Related Research Reports on Chemicals & Materials

The global industrial wastewater treatment chemical market size is estimated to rise from US$ 15.3 billion in 2024 to US$ 26.8 billion by 2034. From 2024 to 2034, the market is anticipated to climb at a CAGR of 5.8%.

The global cooling water treatment chemicals market will likely reach a market value of US$ 12,614 Million in 2023 and is expected to accumulate a market value of US$ 22,589.75 Million by registering a CAGR of 6% in the forecast period 2023-2033.

The global water treatment polymers market is expected to attain a valuation of US$ 43.32 billion in 2023, and is projected to reach US$ 81 billion by 2033. From 2023 to 2033, the market is poised to rise at a CAGR of 6.4%.

The water and wastewater treatment chemicals market continues to witness significant growth driven by increasing concerns over water quality and environmental regulations worldwide. These chemicals play a crucial role in purifying water for various applications, including municipal, industrial, and residential sectors.

The ferric sulphate and polyferric sulphate market to witness a year over year growth of 4.4% in 2022 reaching a value of about US$ 425.7 Million by the end of 2022. The global business is further projected to reach a value of US$ 526.7 Million by the end of the forecast period.

The global sludge treatment chemicals market is estimated to be valued at around US$ 9,561.7 million in 2023 and is further projected to reach US$ 14,456.8 million by 2033.

Sales in the global chlorine disinfectant market are slated to top US$ 2.8 Billion in 2022. Expanding at a healthy 5.0% CAGR, the market size is projected to total US$ 4.2 Billion by 2030.

The global disinfectant chemicals market is forecasted to surge at a CAGR of 5% from 2022 to 2032, expanding to US$ 4 Billion by 2032

In 2023, the global chlorine market is valued at US$ 14,909.7 million. The market is anticipated to reach nearly US$ 22,285.1 million by 2033, with a CAGR of 4.5% from 2023 to 2033.

The sodium chloride market is valued at US$ 44.0 billion in 2023 and is estimated to value at US$ 67.4 billion by 2033, registering a CAGR of 4.4% during the forecast period.

About Future Market Insights (FMI)
